Package model

Class Field

java.lang.Object
model.Field
public class Field extends Object
Field class containing the information of the grids on which the game is played. We have 2 types of grids: one for the player and one for the computer. This is a 10x10 grid, containing 5 ships of different sizes.
Author:
kelvin.likollari@usi.ch

    • shootGrid

      public void shootGrid(int x1, int y1)
      This method is used to check whether the player has hit a cell that has already been hit before. Also, we print a corresponding message to the player.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the cell.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the cell.

    • shootAtCell

      public boolean shootAtCell(int x1, int y1)
      This method shoots at a cell.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the cell.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the cell.
      Returns:
      true if you hit a ship, false in any other case.

    • checkCorrectPlacement

      public boolean checkCorrectPlacement(int x1, int y1, int direction, int length)
      This method checks whether the ship placement is valid (i.e the ship placement is in bounds and does not overlap with other ships).
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the cell.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the cell.
      direction - the direction of the ship.
      length - the length of the ship.
      Returns:
      true if the ship placement is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkEmptyField

      public boolean checkEmptyField()
      This method is used to check whether there is any ship placed in some cells of the field.
      Returns:
      boolean true if there is a ship in the field, false otherwise.

    • canPlaceShip

      public boolean canPlaceShip(int x1, int y1, int direction, int length)
      This method checks whether a ship can be placed in the given position. If the ship can be placed, the ship is placed in the field. If the ship cannot be placed, the method returns false. If the ship can be placed, the method returns true.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the ship.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the ship.
      direction - the direction of the ship.
      length - the length of the ship.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.

    • isValidMoveV2

      public boolean isValidMoveV2(int x1, int y1)
      This method checks whether a shot can be performed in a given position.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the shot.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the shot.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the shot can be performed, false otherwise.

    • setHit

      public void setHit(int x1, int y1)
      This method marks a cell of the field as hit.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the shot.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the shot.

    • setMissed

      public void setMissed(int x1, int y1)
      This method marks a cell of the field after a shot as missed.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the shot.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the shot.

    • isValidPlacementForShip

      public boolean isValidPlacementForShip(int x1, int y1, int size, String direction, boolean horizontal)
      The following method check whether a ship can be placed in a given position.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of the ship.
      y1 - the y coordinate of the ship.
      size - the size of the ship.
      direction - the direction of the ship.
      horizontal - boolean true if the ship is horizontal, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.

    • setShipOfDifferentSize

      public void setShipOfDifferentSize(int x1, int y1, String direction, int size, String symbol)
      The following method sets ships of various sizes 2 to 5 in the field.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x coordinate of where the ship is placed.
      y1 - the y coordinate of where the ship is placed.
      direction - the direction of the ship.
      size - the size of the ship.
      symbol - the symbol of the ship.

      The following method checks whether a shot is valid or not.
      Parameters:
      x1 - x coordinate of the shot.
      y1 - y coordinate of the shot.
      Returns:
      true if the shot is valid, false otherwise.

      Method that checks if a cell is occupied by a ship.
      Parameters:
      index1 - represents the coordinate on the x axis.
      index2 - represents the coordinate on the y axis.
      Returns:
